subject: MICA
title: Prac: Teaching
info: supervised experience in lab instruction. use of instructional materials, tests/measurement.

subject: MICA
title: St Fun Gen Bact Vir
info: structure, function, and metabolism of microorganisms. microbial genetics. molecular virology.
prereqInfo: [one undergrad or grad course each in [microbiology, genetics, biochemistry]] or instr consent

subject: MICA
title: Immunity & Immunop
info: lymphocyte activation, signal transduction in lymphocytes, antigen receptor genetics, antigen presentation, lymphoid anatomy, adaptive immune responses to microbes, immunodeficiency, immunopathology, cytokines, transplantation, autoimmunity.
prereqInfo: upper level undergrad immunology course or  instr consent

subject: MICA
title: Cell. & Cancer Biol.
info: fundamental concepts in cellular, molecular, and genetic basis of disease. molecular basis of inflammation and cancer metastasis. genetic basis for inherited disorders and gene therapy. molecular mechanisms of pathogenesis.
prereqInfo: [one undergrad or grad course each in [biochemistry, cell biology]] or instr consent

subject: MICA
title: MICaB Topics
info: colloquium format. readings/discussion on specialized topic.
prereqInfo: 8012, [8002 or 8003 or 8004] or instr consent

subject: MICA
title: Protein Sequen Anal
info: dna and protein sequence and protein structure databases; protein sequence analysis; methods for display of sequence comparison and prediction results; genetics computer group (gcg) sequence analysis programs; and current literature and research problems.
prereqInfo: biochem course, knowledge of unix operating system recommended

subject: MICA
title: Extracellular Matrix
info: concepts in cell adhesion and tissue composition and importance of cell adhesion in tissue function and disease. topics range from structure/function/assembly of tissue components to cellular adhesion mechanisms.
prereqInfo: 8002 or 8004 or instr consent

subject: MICA
title: Biochemical Aspects
info: aspects of mechanisms involved in growth control at level of nuclear function. neoplasia in hormonal cancers (such as prostate cancer) and role of protein phosphorylation in normal and abnormal growth. mechanisms of cell death via apoptosis and its implications in normal and abnormal proliferation.
prereqInfo: 8004 or [bioc 3021, biol 4004] or instr consent

subject: MICA
title: Microbial Pathogenesis
info: molecular mechanisms of bacterial/viral pathogenesis. strategies of disease causation/interaction with host, regulation of virulence factors, mechanism of virulence factor transmission to other microbes.
prereqInfo: mica grad student or instr

subject: MICA
title: Current Topics in Immunology
info: colloquium format. in-depth reading, discussion
prereqInfo: mica 8003 or instr consent

subject: MICA
title: Grant Skills
info: assist first/second year graduate students to prepare research proposals for funding.
prereqInfo: first or second year micab grad student

subject: MICA
title: Translational Cancer Research
info: clinical issues in cancer research. discuss translational research projects as they pertain to a variety of cancers.
prereqInfo: 8004 or instr consent

subject: MICA
title: Small RNA Biology
info: small rnas as major regulators of gene/protein expression. micrornas and their potential use in diagnosis/prognosis of various disease conditions, including cancers. biology of small rnas and their role in health and disease.
prereqInfo: bioc 8002 or mica 8004 or equiv or instr consent

subject: MICA
title: Research:  MICaB
info: one-on-one research training from faculty adviser during laboratory rotation.
prereqInfo: 1st yr mica grad student

subject: MICA
title: Read Neurobio
info: topics in neurobiology and neurophysiology.

subject: MICA
title: FTE: Master's
info: (no description)
prereqInfo: master's student, adviser and dgs consent

subject: MICA
title: Mucosal Immunobiology
info: host immune processes at body surfaces. innate/adaptive immunity at mucosal surfaces, interactions/responses of various mucosal tissues to pathogens, current approaches being used to target protective vaccination to mucosal tissues. lectures, journal club format.
prereqInfo: 8001 or instr consent

subject: MICA
title: FTE: Doctoral
info: (no description)
prereqInfo: doctoral student, adviser and dgs consent

subject: MICA
title: Doct Pre-Thesis Cr
info: tbd
prereqInfo: doctoral student who has not passed prelim oral; no required consent for 1st/2nd registrations, up to 12 combined cr; dept consent for 3rd/4th registrations, up to 24 combined cr; doctoral student admitted before summer 2007 may register up to four times, up to 60 combined cr

subject: MICA
title: Thesis Credit:Mast*
info: (no description)
prereqInfo: max 18 cr per semester or summer; 10 cr total required [plan a only]

subject: MICA
title: Thesis Credit:Doct*
info: thesis credit: doctoral.
prereqInfo: micab phd student, adviser consent

subject: MICA
title: Seminar:  Faculty
info: state-of-the-art information presented by scientific experts within/outside the university.
prereqInfo: micab grad student

subject: MICA
title: Seminar:  Students
info: current thesis topics and other aspects of microbiology, immunology, and cancer biology.
prereqInfo: micab grad student or instr consent
